workflow.name: Generate prospect research & connection strategy reports with Claude AI
workflow.description:
## Who‚Äôs it for üéØ  
This workflow is ideal for **outreach specialists, fundraisers, campaigners, and professionals who want to build authentic connections** by researching prospects deeply and strategically. It helps users understand prospects‚Äô backgrounds, interests, and mutual connections to craft effective outreach.

## How it works / What it does ‚öôÔ∏è  
Using the [Multi-tool Research Agent](https://n8n.io/workflows/5588-multi-tool-research-agent-for-animal-advocacy-with-openrouter-serper-and-open-paws-db/) subworkflow, it analyzes both the prospector‚Äôs and prospect‚Äôs profiles, social media, and online presence. The workflow verifies identities, uncovers key connection points, and generates a comprehensive HTML report with actionable insights, conversation starters, and suggested engagement tactics.

## How to set up üõ†Ô∏è  
1. Import this workflow and the [Multi-tool Research Agent subworkflow](https://n8n.io/workflows/5588-multi-tool-research-agent-for-animal-advocacy-with-openrouter-serper-and-open-paws-db/).  
2. Configure required API credentials.  
3. Provide inputs: prospector and prospect names, social media URLs, and outreach goal.  
4. Test the workflow to ensure accurate research and report generation.

## Requirements üìã  
- n8n instance with internet access  
- Valid API keys  
- Multi-tool Research Agent subworkflow installed and linked  
- Optional email node for sending reports directly

## How to customize üîß  
- Update input parameters to suit your outreach use case.  
- Modify research prompts in the subworkflow for tone or focus.  
- Customize the HTML report design for branding or format preferences.  
- Attach an email node to send reports automatically or route output as needed.

---

Use this workflow to power personalized, strategic outreach with data-driven insights.

workflow.name: Personalized prospect research and connection strategy report generator

parameters.text:
=CRITICAL OUTPUT INSTRUCTIONS ‚Äî READ CAREFULLY 1. FORMAT REQUIREMENTS: - Begin immediately with valid HTML - no markdown, backticks, or explanations - First line must be raw HTML (e.g.,
,
, etc.) - Use semantic HTML5 tags (
,
,

-

,

,

    , , etc.) - Include minimal inline CSS for readability (headings, spacing, colors) - Create a mobile-responsive design 2. CONTENT STRUCTURE: - Title: "Prospect Research Report: [Prospect Name]" - Executive Summary: 2-3 sentence overview highlighting key connection opportunities - Background: Professional history, current role, company information - Personal Interests: Hobbies, causes, affiliations - Connection Points: Shared interests, experiences, or network connections with prospector - Engagement Strategy: Suggested talking points and approach - Sources: All references with properly formatted citations 3. CITATION HANDLING: - Every external reference must be a clickable link (Source Name) - Include the full visible URL text after each citation (e.g., "Source Name (https://example.com)") - Group citations by section at the bottom of each relevant area 4. DATA PROCESSING: - Merge and synthesize all information from the research data - Eliminate redundancies while preserving all unique insights - When conflicting information exists, note both versions with sources - If critical information is missing, note this briefly rather than claiming more research is needed 5. INSUFFICIENT INFORMATION HANDLING: - If multiple people with the same/similar names were found, create a section called "IDENTITY VERIFICATION NEEDED" - In this section, list the different individuals found with distinguishing details for each - Include a clear HTML-formatted recommendation box suggesting specific additional information needed: ‚Ä¢ "Please request a new research report with the following information to ensure accurate identification:" ‚Ä¢ Request social media profiles (LinkedIn, Twitter, etc.) ‚Ä¢ Request company name, location, or other distinguishing professional details ‚Ä¢ Request any personal details that might help distinguish from others with similar names - If general information is sparse (regardless of identity clarity), include an "ADDITIONAL INFORMATION NEEDED" section - List specific types of missing information that would improve the report's usefulness - Format these recommendations prominently in a bordered box with a distinct background color 6. PERSONALIZATION: - The prospect is {{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Prospect Name'] }} - The prospector is {{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Prospector Name'] }} - Address the report directly to the prospector - Focus on actionable insights that enable meaningful connection - Highlight 2-3 specific conversation starters based on the prospect's interests or background 7. TONE AND STYLE: - Professional but conversational - Concise with bullet points where appropriate - Scannable with clear headings and short paragraphs - Objective but warm - focus on factual information presented in a helpful manner 8. INPUT DATA: {{ $json.output }} This report should serve as a comprehensive but easily digestible guide that empowers the prospector to make an authentic personal connection with the prospect.

value.chatInput:
=# COMPREHENSIVE PROSPECT RESEARCH DIRECTIVE

## RESEARCH OBJECTIVE

Research and analyze all available information about both the prospect and the prospector to identify optimal connection points. Your research must be thorough, accurate, and strategically aligned with the outreach goal.

PROSPECT: {{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Prospect Name'] }}
PROSPECTOR: {{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Prospector Name'] }}
OUTREACH GOAL: {{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Outreach Goal'] }}

## PROVIDED SOCIAL PROFILES

### PROSPECT PROFILES
- LinkedIn: {{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Prospect Linkedin URL'] }}
- Twitter: {{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Prospect Twitter URL'] }}
- Instagram:{{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Prospect Instagram URL'] }}

### PROSPECTOR PROFILES
- LinkedIn: {{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Prospector Linkedin URL'] }}
- Twitter: {{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Prospector Twitter URL'] }}
- Instagram: {{ $('When Executed by Another Workflow').item.json['Prospector Instagram URL'] }}

## RESEARCH METHODOLOGY

### 1. PROFILE VERIFICATION
- Verify that all provided profiles belong to the correct individuals
- If multiple people share the same name, document distinguishing characteristics
- Flag any uncertainty about profile ownership with clear reasoning

### 2. DEPTH-FIRST RESEARCH APPROACH
- For each valid social profile, extract and document:
  * Professional history and achievements
  * Educational background
  * Geographic history (past and present locations)
  * Interests, hobbies, and passions
  * Values and causes they support
  * Content themes they engage with
  * Posting patterns and engagement style
  * Key relationships and networking patterns
- For each extracted data point, include the exact URL source

### 3. EXPANDED SEARCH BEYOND PROVIDED PROFILES
- Search for additional online presence (other platforms, websites, etc.)
- Locate published content (articles, interviews, presentations)
- Find event participation (conferences, webinars, panels)
- Identify organizational affiliations (professional, volunteer, social)
- Discover mentions in media and third-party sources
- Document each new source with complete URLs

## CONNECTION ANALYSIS FRAMEWORK

Systematically identify and evaluate potential connection points in these categories:

1. PROFESSIONAL CONNECTIONS
   - Shared employers or business partners
   - Industry overlap and similar roles
   - Professional organizations/groups
   - Mentors/colleagues in common
   - Parallel career trajectories

2. EDUCATIONAL INTERSECTIONS
   - Shared alma maters (any level)
   - Similar fields of study
   - Overlapping time periods at institutions
   - Notable professors or programs in common

3. GEOGRAPHIC CONNECTIONS
   - Current location proximity
   - Shared previous locations
   - Regional cultural references or affiliations

4. PERSONAL ALIGNMENT
   - Common interests and hobbies
   - Shared values and causes
   - Similar content engagement patterns
   - Complementary personality indicators

5. NETWORK OVERLAP
   - Mutual connections (1st, 2nd, 3rd degree)
   - Shared event attendance
   - Common group memberships
   - Similar audience engagement

## HANDLING INFORMATION GAPS

If initial searches yield insufficient information:

1. IDENTITY VERIFICATION ISSUES
   - Expand search parameters to include alternative spellings, nicknames, or maiden names
   - Search for company affiliations + name combinations
   - Cross-reference with mentions in industry publications or events
   - If multiple potential matches persist, document each with distinguishing characteristics

2. INSUFFICIENT CONNECTION DATA
   - Expand search beyond standard social platforms to niche forums, local news, alumni directories
   - Investigate company websites, team pages, and press releases
   - Look for content collaborations, co-authored works, panel discussions
   - Search for comments and interactions on third-party content
   - Explore professional repositories like GitHub, SlideShare, or Medium

## CITATION AND SOURCING REQUIREMENTS

- Every factual claim must include an inline citation with the complete URL
- Format: [Claim or information]. (SOURCE: https://full.url.here)
- Include a comprehensive source list at the end of each section
- Evaluate and note the credibility/recency of each source
- For social media sources, include specific post dates where possible

## OUTPUT FORMATTING

Your research report must:

1. Begin directly with substantive findings - no preamble or methodology explanation
2. Use clear hierarchical headings for easy navigation
3. Employ bullet points and numbered lists for scannable content
4. Bold key connection points and high-value insights
5. Include a "Priority Connection Opportunities" section at the beginning
6. Maximize length through RELEVANT information only
7. Include all source URLs both inline and in a comprehensive reference section

Your output will be processed by another system, so strict adherence to these formatting guidelines is essential.

parameters.content:
# üìù Input & User Preferences
- User inputs: Prospector name, Prospect name, and social media URLs for both.
- Also input the outreach goal describing why the connection is sought.
- These inputs feed into the research subworkflow.
- Make sure all URLs are valid and correct to improve research accuracy.

# üîç Research via Multi-tool Research Agent
- Single call to the [Multi-tool Research Agent](https://n8n.io/workflows/5588-multi-tool-research-agent-for-animal-advocacy-with-openrouter-serper-and-open-paws-db/).  
- Performs profile verification, deep research, and connection analysis for both prospector and prospect.  
- Extracts professional history, affiliations, interests, network overlaps, and other relevant data.  
- Flags uncertainties or identity verification issues.

# üìÑ Generate HTML Prospect Research Report
- Builds a detailed, mobile-friendly HTML report addressed to the prospector.  
- Sections include: Executive Summary, Background, Personal Interests, Connection Points, Engagement Strategy, Sources.  
- Includes clickable full URLs grouped by section.  
- Bold key insights and suggested talking points.  
- Can be sent as an HTML email, returned to an AI agent, or posted online (e.g., Gist).

user.name: Open Paws
user.bio:
Open Paws is a nonprofit building open-source AI tools to accelerate animal advocacy. 

We create machine learning models and automation workflows trained on real-world campaign data to help end industrial animal exploitation. 

All tools are free, transparent, and designed for real-world impact.

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.
